segments.pli: “Yo so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkosakaparibhāsako ariyūpavādī sabrahmacārīnaṃ, tassa pañca ādīnavā pāṭikaṅkhā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, can expect these five drawbacks.

segments.pli: Pārājiko vā hoti chinnaparipantho, aññataraṃ vā saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, bāḷhaṃ vā rogātaṅkaṃ phusati, sammūḷho kālaṃ karoti, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: They’re expelled, cut off, shut out; or they commit a corrupt offense; or they contract a severe illness. They die confused. And when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: Yo so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkosakaparibhāsako ariyūpavādī sabrahmacārīnaṃ, tassa ime pañca ādīnavā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, can expect these five drawbacks.”
